ca.utoronto.msrg.padres.common.comm
Interface ConnectionListenerInterface

All Known Implementing Classes:
OverlayManager 
public interface ConnectionListenerInterface

Author:
Bala Maniymaran Created: 2010-08-12 This specifies the interface of an connection manager entity. When an object implementing this interface is registered with a server, it can be informed using the methods specified here when a new connection is or an existing one is broken.
See Also:
CommServer

Method Summary
 void connectionBroke(MessageDestination msgDest)
          To inform a connection listener that an existing connection is broken by the client
 void connectionMade(MessageDestination clientDest, MessageSender msgSender)
          To inform the object implementing this interface about a connection made by a client.
 

Method Detail

connectionMade

void connectionMade(MessageDestination clientDest,
                    MessageSender msgSender)
To inform the object implementing this interface about a connection made by a client.

Parameters:
clientDest - The client destination who made the connection
msgSender - A new MessageSender entity created by the server who accepted the connection. This msgSender can be used by the connection listener object to communicate with the client who made the connection. In other words, the connection is preserved, encapsulated in msgSender, and passed over to the connection listener to use.

connectionBroke

void connectionBroke(MessageDestination msgDest)
To inform a connection listener that an existing connection is broken by the client

Parameters:
msgDest - The destination of the client with whom the connection was made (same as the one who broke the connection)
